3.title: React Best Practices
3.content:
# React Best Practices

## Component Structure
- Use functional components with hooks
- Keep components small and focused
- Implement proper prop validation

## State Management
```javascript
// Use useState for local state
const [count, setCount] = useState(0);

// Use useReducer for complex state
const [state, dispatch] = useReducer(reducer, initialState);
```

## Performance Tips
- Use React.memo for expensive components
- Implement useCallback and useMemo wisely
- Avoid inline object/function creation in render

6.title: Tools & Setup
6.content:
# Development Tools & Environment Setup

This page contains all my development environment configurations and tool recommendations.

## Essential Tools
- VS Code with extensions
- Git workflow
- Package managers (npm/yarn/pnpm)
- Build tools and bundlers

## Environment Variables
```bash
# Development
NODE_ENV=development
REACT_APP_API_URL=http://localhost:3001

# Production
NODE_ENV=production
REACT_APP_API_URL=https://api.example.com
```

7.title: VS Code Extensions
7.content:
# Essential VS Code Extensions

## Must-Have Extensions

### Code Quality
1. **Prettier** - Code formatter
   - Auto-format on save
   - Consistent code style

2. **ESLint** - Code linting
   - Catch errors early
   - Enforce coding standards

3. **GitLens** - Git supercharged
   - Blame annotations
   - Commit history

### Productivity
1. **Auto Rename Tag** - Sync HTML/JSX tags
2. **Bracket Pair Colorizer** - Color-coded brackets
3. **Thunder Client** - API testing in VS Code

### React-Specific
1. **ES7+ React/Redux/React-Native snippets**
2. **React Developer Tools**
3. **vscode-styled-components**

## Configuration
```json
{
  "editor.formatOnSave": true,
  "editor.codeActionsOnSave": {
    "source.fixAll.eslint": true
  },
  "emmet.includeLanguages": {
    "javascript": "javascriptreact"
  }
}
```

8.title: Git Workflow
8.content:
# Git Workflow & Best Practices

## Branch Strategy
```bash
# Feature branch workflow
git checkout -b feature/user-authentication
git add .
git commit -m "feat: implement user login"
git push origin feature/user-authentication
```

## Conventional Commits
- `feat:` new feature
- `fix:` bug fix
- `docs:` documentation
- `style:` formatting
- `refactor:` code refactoring
- `test:` adding tests
- `chore:` maintenance

## Git Configuration
```bash
# Global setup
git config --global user.name "Your Name"
git config --global user.email "your.email@example.com"
git config --global init.defaultBranch main

# Useful aliases
git config --global alias.st status
git config --global alias.co checkout
git config --global alias.br branch
git config --global alias.lg "log --oneline --graph --all"
```

11.title: Technical Books
11.content:
# Must-Read Technical Books

## Programming Fundamentals

### ğŸ“˜ Clean Code - Robert C. Martin
**Status:** âœ… Completed | **Rating:** â­â­â­â­â­

**Key Takeaways:**
- Meaningful names make code self-documenting
- Functions should do one thing well
- Comments are often a code smell
- Boy Scout Rule: Leave code cleaner than you found it

**Favorite Quote:**
> "Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand."

### ğŸ“— The Pragmatic Programmer - Hunt & Thomas
**Status:** âœ… Completed | **Rating:** â­â­â­â­â­

**Key Concepts:**
- DRY Principle (Don't Repeat Yourself)
- Broken Window Theory
- Rubber Duck Debugging
- Code orthogonality

### ğŸ“™ You Don't Know JS - Kyle Simpson
**Status:** ğŸ”„ Reading (Book 3/6) | **Rating:** â­â­â­â­

**Progress:**
- âœ… Up & Going
- âœ… Scope & Closures  
- ğŸ”„ this & Object Prototypes
- â³ Types & Grammar
- â³ Async & Performance
- â³ ES6 & Beyond

## System Design

### ğŸ“’ Designing Data-Intensive Applications
**Status:** â³ On Reading List | **Priority:** High

**Why Important:**
- Scalability patterns
- Database design
- Distributed systems concepts

### ğŸ“• System Design Interview - Alex Xu
**Status:** ğŸ”„ Reading | **Rating:** â­â­â­â­

13.title: Project Alpha - E-commerce Platform
13.content:
# Project Alpha - E-commerce Platform

## Project Overview
Building a modern, scalable e-commerce platform from scratch to replace the legacy system.

## Tech Stack

### Frontend
- **Framework:** React 18 with TypeScript
- **Styling:** Tailwind CSS + Headless UI
- **State Management:** Zustand
- **Routing:** React Router v6
- **Forms:** React Hook Form + Zod validation

### Backend
- **Runtime:** Node.js 18
- **Framework:** Express.js
- **Database:** MongoDB with Mongoose
- **Authentication:** JWT + Refresh tokens
- **File Storage:** AWS S3
- **Email:** SendGrid

### DevOps
- **Deployment:** Vercel (Frontend) + Railway (Backend)
- **CI/CD:** GitHub Actions
- **Monitoring:** Sentry + LogRocket
- **Testing:** Jest + React Testing Library

## Project Phases

### âœ… Phase 1: Foundation (Completed)
- User authentication system
- Basic UI components library
- Database schema design
- API architecture setup

### ğŸ”„ Phase 2: Core Features (In Progress - 65%)
- Product catalog management
- Shopping cart functionality
- Order processing system
- Payment integration (Stripe)

### â³ Phase 3: Advanced Features (Planned)
- Inventory management
- Analytics dashboard
- Marketing tools
- Mobile app companion

## Current Sprint Goals
- [ ] Complete checkout flow
- [ ] Implement order history
- [ ] Add product reviews system
- [ ] Setup email notifications

## Challenges & Solutions

### Challenge: State Management Complexity
**Problem:** Managing cart state across multiple components
**Solution:** Implemented Zustand store with persist middleware

### Challenge: Payment Security
**Problem:** PCI compliance requirements
**Solution:** Using Stripe Elements for secure payment handling

## Key Learnings
1. TypeScript significantly reduces runtime errors
2. Proper error boundaries improve user experience
3. API rate limiting is crucial for production apps
4. Comprehensive testing saves debugging time


## Database Schema

### Users Collection
```javascript
{
  _id: ObjectId,
  email: String,
  password: String, // hashed
  profile: {
    firstName: String,
    lastName: String,
    avatar: String,
    dateOfBirth: Date
  },
  addresses: [{
    type: String, // 'shipping' | 'billing'
    street: String,
    city: String,
    country: String,
    postalCode: String
  }],
  createdAt: Date,
  updatedAt: Date
}
```

### Products Collection
```javascript
{
  _id: ObjectId,
  name: String,
  slug: String,
  description: String,
  price: Number,
  images: [String],
  category: ObjectId,
  inventory: {
    quantity: Number,
    reserved: Number,
    available: Number
  },
  specifications: Map,
  isActive: Boolean,
  createdAt: Date,
  updatedAt: Date
}
```

### Orders Collection
```javascript
{
  _id: ObjectId,
  userId: ObjectId,
  items: [{
    productId: ObjectId,
    quantity: Number,
    price: Number,
    name: String
  }],
  totals: {
    subtotal: Number,
    tax: Number,
    shipping: Number,
    total: Number
  },
  status: String, // 'pending' | 'confirmed' | 'shipped' | 'delivered'
  paymentMethod: String,
  shippingAddress: Object,
  createdAt: Date,
  updatedAt: Date
}
```

## API Design

### RESTful Endpoints
```
GET    /api/products              # List products
GET    /api/products/:id          # Get product details
POST   /api/products              # Create product (admin)
PUT    /api/products/:id          # Update product (admin)
DELETE /api/products/:id          # Delete product (admin)

POST   /api/auth/login            # User login
POST   /api/auth/register         # User registration
POST   /api/auth/logout           # User logout
GET    /api/auth/me               # Get current user

GET    /api/cart                  # Get user cart
POST   /api/cart/items            # Add item to cart
PUT    /api/cart/items/:id        # Update cart item
DELETE /api/cart/items/:id        # Remove from cart

POST   /api/orders                # Create order
GET    /api/orders                # Get user orders
GET    /api/orders/:id            # Get order details
```

## Security Measures

### Authentication
- JWT tokens with 15-minute expiry
- Refresh tokens with 7-day expiry
- HTTP-only cookies for token storage
- Rate limiting on auth endpoints

### Data Validation
- Input sanitization using express-validator
- Schema validation with Joi
- SQL injection prevention
- XSS protection with helmet.js

### Infrastructure Security
- HTTPS everywhere
- CORS configuration
- Environment variables for secrets
- Database connection encryption
